quest.name: Pulling Double Booty
journal: Hansaku is desperately searching for a charitable soul willing to lend him a hand.

A man by the name of Hansaku stops you to ask if you know anything of the East Aldenard Trading Company. When you inform him that you are acquaintances with their head of shop in Kugane, he begs you to meet with his superior, Tsukikage, who has been looking to establish a new trading partner. He then points you in the direction of Crick, where you can find him. If you are feeling generous, make your way there and speak with Tsukikage.

After brief introductions, Tsukikage divulges that the men he just took into his custody are claiming to be merchants with the East Aldenard Trading Company. He thinks they are lying to avoid paying the Ruby Tithe. For fear of incurring the wrath of a potential business partner, however, he would like to make absolutely certain before seeking retribution and requests your help with this endeavor. Asking that you take the flag he obtained from their ship along with a list of the items they found aboard the vessel, he would like for you to present it to one of the merchants in the Kugane branch office and inquire if any of it belongs to their organization.

You stop one of the East Aldenard Trading Company merchants and ask him if the scarlet flag or items on the inventory list belong to them. Sadly, he appears to know no more than you do and suggests you speak with one of the merchants in charge of cargo at Pier #1 named Kikimo. Head over there to see what you can learn from her.

Kikimo glances at the flag and list, and immediately tells you they do not belong to the East Aldenard Trading Company. She then goes on to lament the fact that you were the one to ask her. Had it been anyone else, she would have tried to swindle the goods out from under them by claiming the ship as one of their own. Right before you turn to go, she asks you to get in touch should the Confederacy be looking to sell any of what they confiscated. Tsukikage should be delighted to hear the news.

You return the items to Tsukikage and confirm what he suspected all along─that the men they apprehended were lying about their affiliation to the East Aldenard Trading Company. In spite of this, he remains in high spirits, much of which can be attributed to Kikimo's business proposal to find buyers for the Confederacy's goods. It seems things have finally started to look up for the pirates of Onokoro.
objectives: Show an East Aldenard Trading Company merchant in Kugane the scarlet flag and inventory list.
Show Kikimo the scarlet flag and inventory list.
Return the scarlet flag and inventory list to Tsukikage in Onokoro.

dialogue.name: HANSAKU
dialogue.text: Your clothes, your manner─you must be a womanman of Eorzea!

dialogue.name: HANSAKU
dialogue.text: Do you know of the East Aldenard Trading Company, then? I hear they're a fairly prosperous vendor where you are from.

dialogue.name: HANSAKU
dialogue.text: You're acquaintances with the Kugane branch office owner!? Oho! The chief's been searching high and low for a well-connected womanman such as yourself.

dialogue.name: HANSAKU
dialogue.text: Oh, but before we get into that, allow me to introduce myself. I am Hansaku. And you would be...?

dialogue.name: HANSAKU
dialogue.text: Forename? That should be easy enough to remember. Now, Forename do me a favor and meet with the chief, would you?

dialogue.name: HANSAKU
dialogue.text: Ever since those damned Garleans strengthened their grip on Hingashi, our contacts in Kugane have quit trading with us. He could really use your help in establishing a new business partner.

dialogue.name: HANSAKU
dialogue.text: Please, I wouldn't ask if I wasn't desperate. You see, I only just joined the Confederacy. Life has been hard─really hard─for me lately, and if things were to fall apart here, I'd have nowhere to go...

dialogue.name: HANSAKU
dialogue.text: To the west of this place is a tiny lodge. The chief should be there. Unfortunately I cannot leave my post to show you there, but I trust you'll find it easily enough. I'm counting on you, Forename!

dialogue.name: HANSAKU
dialogue.text: If you have any trouble finding it, just ask around for Tsukikage─that's the chief's name.

dialogue.name: SUZUME
dialogue.text: As you can see, we are currently in the middle of something important. Come back later.

dialogue.name: FUNANORIOKO02687
dialogue.text: I swear to the gods you're going to regret doing this!

dialogue.name: FUNANORI02687
dialogue.text: Instead of standing there and gawping, help me out of these ropes, godsdammit!

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: Gentlemen, since you refuse to pay the Ruby Tithe with coin, you shall instead be paying with your blood. I believe an arm each will suffice.

dialogue.name: FUNANORIOKO02687
dialogue.text: W-Wait! We're with the East Aldenard Trading Company! I-I suggest you think twice about this. When word of this gets back, you'll be the ones to pay!

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: Oh? You should have said so sooner. Suzume, see that our distinguished guests are escorted to our best room─in the dungeons. I shall go and sharpen my knives.

dialogue.name: SUZUME
dialogue.text: You heard the man.

dialogue.name: SUZUME
dialogue.text: Get up and start walking!

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: I trust you stuck around this long because there was something you wished to discuss with me? Make it quick. As you can see, I am a very busy man.

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: So at last we are joined by someone actually associated with the East Aldenard Trading Company. Excellent.

dialogue.name: SUZUME
dialogue.text: The kami have thrown us a lifeline, sir! That said, what was the fool thinking? Hansaku should have had the courtesy to accompany our honored guest here! Please allow me to apologize on his behalf, MistressMaster...?

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: Ah, it seems the ill manners of our subordinate have begun to rub off on us. We have not yet introduced ourselves. I am Tsukikage and this is my right hand, Suzume.

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: While it seems Hansaku has touched upon the gist of our troubles, please allow me to fill you in on the details.

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: As you know, all boats seeking safe passage through the Ruby Sea must pay our levy─the Ruby Tithe. Give us more than we ask, and we might even provide you with men to guide your ship through especially difficult waters.

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: For as far back as anyone can remember, this system has been in place, enduring even after Doma was occupied by the imperials. While the Empire has always shown little interest in our activities, with Yotsuyu's rise to power, that has changed.

dialogue.name: SUZUME
dialogue.text: The royal viceroy has banned the merchants of Kugane from bartering with us or paying our tolls. With those bakufu dogs backing her, everyone is far too terrified to disobey.

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: Many outside the port city are also looking to use the current state of affairs to avoid paying their dues─like the two we just took into custody. While we have confiscated their goods, without our contact in Kugane to purchase them, they are of little value to us.

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: Thus we look to Othard. If we were able to establish a trade agreement with their biggest vendor, our worries would be over. It is, however, something we cannot accomplish alone. I would look to you for help.

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: Now, I am quite certain the men on the ship we seized are lying about their affiliation.

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: Suzume, show herhim.

dialogue.name: SUZUME
dialogue.text: This flag and the items we found aboard the vessel do not appear to belong to the East Aldenard Trading Company. We must, however, be certain. We cannot risk raising the ire of a potential trading partner by attempting to sell them their own goods.

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: Please, take the flag and Suzume's inventory list to one of your contacts at their Kugane branch and inquire as to whether any of it is from one of their ships.

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: The flag should be enough, but you best also show them that list.

dialogue.name: SUZUME
dialogue.text: We manage the entirety of the Confederacy's finances, which includes both monetary funds and assets. What you hold in your hands is a list of property we seized from the ship. Do not lose it. It may look easy to draft, but unless you have the eye for detail that I do, you'll find it a real chore.

dialogue.name: SHOUNIN02687
dialogue.text: MistressMaster Surname. What a pleasure it is to see you. How might I be of service to you today?

dialogue.name: SHOUNIN02687
dialogue.text: You would like to know if this flag, or any of the items listed here came from one of our ships?

dialogue.name: SHOUNIN02687
dialogue.text: I am afraid I cannot help you there. Kikimo, however, might be able to tell you. She is in charge of inventory and is currently stocking our ships at Pier #1.

dialogue.name: SHOUNIN02687
dialogue.text: You best ask Kikimo, as she is charged with keeping track of the cargo that is loaded and taken off the ships. You should be able to find her at Pier #1.

dialogue.name: KIKIMO
dialogue.text: Hm? And who might you be? Ah, MistressMaster Surname? I have heard a great deal about you. Very well. I shall take a look at your flag and list.

dialogue.name: KIKIMO
dialogue.text: ...None of these items are even remotely familiar. It is as you suspected. You have been lied to.

dialogue.name: KIKIMO
dialogue.text: <sigh> 'Tis a shame you were the one to ask. Had it been anyone else, it would have been an easy thing to claim the ship and its goods as our own.

dialogue.name: KIKIMO
dialogue.text: Many of the items listed here are worth their weight in gold and then some. With this, those men could have easily paid the tithe several times over...

dialogue.name: KIKIMO
dialogue.text: Such luxurious items can be rather hard to come by, so do let me know if your friends are looking to sell any of this. We would be more than happy to find a buyer for them.

dialogue.name: KIKIMO
dialogue.text: To think that you even have contacts within the ranks of the Confederacy─you are just as they say: a womanman of many parts.

dialogue.name: SUZUME
dialogue.text: You have made it safely back. I hope your trip to Kugane proved fruitful?

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: MistressMaster Forename, you are returned. Very good. Now if you would be so kind as to give the flag and list back to me.

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: Hm. It was as we suspected, then. In light of Mistress Kikimo's proposal, however, not even their evident guilt can sour my mood.

dialogue.name: SUZUME
dialogue.text: Indeed! This is fantastic news, sir. It is everything we had hoped for and more!

dialogue.name: TSUKIKAGE
dialogue.text: While certainly promising, we are not yet out of the woods. MistressMaster Forename, I trust we can rely on your continued support? I have a feeling we will be needing it.
